a)
For a=0.8, b=0.1

2	2	80.5219333958741

For a=0.9,b=0.05

1	2	82.7839635503621
2	2	82.7839635503621
3	2	86.8087466083146
4	3	85.0402129909481
5	0	-70
6	2	84.8379031901398
7	2	86.9074124242193
8	2	89.0039278542379
9	4	90.6019588017837
10	2	93.0503115456947
11	4	86.7982061895169
12	4	89.0039278542379
13	2	91.2417245361313
14	4	93.1848440830136
15	2	95.3530243154424
16	4	79.9833779905618
17	2	90.3358391124845
18	4	93.4044810566378
19	4	95.5863929703145
20	2	97.6659931105079
21	0	-70
22	4	93.0471937688508
23	4	95.3644623285384
24	4	97.6659931105079
25	0	100


b)As the value of 'b' gets low i.e. the uncertainity, the optimal stage is quickly reached. The robot starts to go towards the goal state more quickly than before 
and also takes more optimal path as there is no noise. 

c) Decreasing 'b' results in approaching the optimal stage more quickly and the robot starts to approach target without any noise.
